author: Amrith Ramkumar
title: Commodities Continue Rally as Investors Embrace Risk
text:
Commodities are on track for a 10th straight session of gains on Monday, another sign that investors have shrugged off recent market volatility and are diving back in to risky assets.
The S&P GSCI Index, which tracks the prices of 24 commodities, has been moving in tandem with global stock markets since last summer as money managers look to capitalize on accelerating global economic growth. The index has risen 5.4% off its Feb. 9 lows, with some of the most actively traded raw materials like oil and copper rebounding following...
